hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
# ====== CONFIGURATION ====== DATE=$(date +%F-%H-%M) REPO_DIR="$WORKSPACE/git-backup" # Dedicated Git repo folder BACKUP_DIR="$REPO_DIR/jenkins-backup-$DATE" JENKINS_HOME="/var/lib/jenkins" BRANCH="main" CREDENTIALS_NAME="Jenkins Backup Bot" CREDENTIALS_EMAIL="jenkins@example.com" GIT_REPO="git@github.com:mdnisarga9/pipeline.git" # ============================
echo "Creating backup directory at: $BACKUP_DIR" mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
echo "Copying Jenkins data..." cp -r "$JENKINS_HOME/jobs" "$BACKUP_DIR/" cp -r "$JENKINS_HOME/plugins" "$BACKUP_DIR/" cp -r "$JENKINS_HOME/users" "$BACKUP_DIR/" cp "$JENKINS_HOME/config.xml" "$BACKUP_DIR/" cp "$JENKINS_HOME/credentials.xml" "$BACKUP_DIR/" 2>/dev/null || echo "No credentials.xml found."
echo "Initializing Git repo..." cd "$REPO_DIR" if [ ! -d ".git" ]; then git init git remote add origin "$GIT_REPO" git checkout -b "$BRANCH" else git fetch origin "$BRANCH" git checkout "$BRANCH" git pull --rebase origin "$BRANCH" || echo "⚠ No remote branch to rebase, continuing..." fi
git config user.email "$CREDENTIALS_EMAIL" git config user.name "$CREDENTIALS_NAME"
echo "Adding and committing backup..." git add . git commit -m "Jenkins Backup on $DATE" || echo "⚠ Nothing to commit."
echo "Pushing to GitHub..." # Use --force if you want Jenkins to always overwrite remote git push origin "$BRANCH" || git push --force origin "$BRANCH"
echo "✅ Backup completed and pushed to GitHub."
